intro: Heterospathe elegans subsp. elegans, commonly known as the slender marsh fern, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Thelypteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves that form a dense, upright rosette. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a smooth, glossy surface. The spores are produced in small, clustered sporangia located on the underside of the fronds.
